meanings.def: a place where people live temporarily in tents or temporary buildings
examples: Let's return to camp.
to pitch/set up camp (= put up tents)
to break/strike camp (= take down tents)
We broke camp early the next morning.
We pitched camp just outside the woods.

meanings.def: a place where children go in the summer and take part in sports and other activities
examples: a tennis/soccer camp
I used to attend a summer music camp for five weeks.
at camp He spent two weeks at camp this summer.
a camp counsellor (= somebody who works with young people at a summer camp)

meanings.def: a place where people are kept in temporary buildings or tents, especially by a government and often for long periods
examples: They criticized the appalling conditions in the refugee camps.
a detention/an internment camp
They were repeatedly beaten by camp guards.

meanings.def: a place where soldiers live while they are training or fighting
examples: an army camp

meanings.def: a group of people who have the same ideas about something and oppose people with other ideas
examples: the socialist camp
We were in opposing camps.
The region split into two armed camps.
People are split into two camps on this issue.
He was a politician who switched camps when it suited him.

meanings.def: one of the sides in a competition and the people connected with it
examples: There was an air of confidence in the England camp.

meanings.def: to be involved in or connected with two different groups, especially ones that oppose each other

idioms.idiom: have/keep a foot in both camps
idioms.def: to be involved in or connected with two different groups, especially ones that oppose each other

meanings.def: to put up a tent and live in it for a short time
examples: I camped overnight in a field.

meanings.def: to stay in a tent, especially while you are on holiday
examples: They go camping in France every year.

meanings.def: to live in somebody’s house for a short time, especially when you do not have a bed there
examples: I'm camping out at a friend's apartment at the moment.

meanings.def: (of a character in a video game) to stay in one place in order to keep attacking enemies and gain an advantage
examples: I can’t get through to the market square as someone’s camping on top of the base.

meanings.def: deliberately behaving in an exaggerated way that some people think is typical of a gay man
examples: He’s so camp, isn’t he?

meanings.def: having a style that is exaggerated and not in good taste, especially in a deliberately humorous way
examples: The movie is a camp celebration of the fashion industry.
